section.show.option: [ This section may not be visible. ]
instruction.help: Instructions for completing sections on form
include.page1: Please include the cover page of each impacted licence, a valid Medical Device Single Audit Program [MDSAP] Certificate that reflects the change in the manufacturer’s name or address, a completed F202 form, and a signed attestation form as applicable.
help.load.file.01: A file should not be loaded if this is the first time enrolling the Company.
help.load.file.02: When continuing with a working copy, the format of the file to load should be (.hcsc).
help.load.file.03: When viewing/updating a draft or final XML file, the format of the file to load should be (.xml).
help.heading.01: The “Enrolment Status”, “Enrolment Version”, and “Date Last Saved” fields are automatically filled by the form upon selecting “Save Working Copy” or “Save Draft XML” in the bottom of the template.
help.heading.02: The “Company Identifier” field will be filled by Health Canada when they generate the final company XML file.
help.heading.03: The “Amend Enrolment” button is only enabled when a final company xml file is loaded into the template, and must be selected when amending a final company XML file.
help.business.num.01: A business number is a unique, 9-digit number (i.e., the standard identifier for businesses). It is unique to a business or legal entity. Information on the business number can be found on the
help.status.01: A new contact should be identified with “new” status.
help.status.02: A revision to an exisiting contact should be identified with “revise” status.
help.status.03: A deactivation of an existing contact should be identified with “delete” status.
help.routing.id.01: The routing identifier is a unique identifier within the Electronic Submissions Gateway (ESG) for each account, used to identify the specific gateway account, whether it uses the Applicability Statement 2 (AS2) or WebTrader interfaces.
help.routing.id.01a: Health Canada plans to use the routing identifier in the near future to send documents back to companies using the ESG. Companies will be notified before Health Canada begins implementing this new process. In the meantime, this field is optional, and the input routing identifier will only be stored in our internal databases for now.
help.routing.id.02: For the WebTrader users, the routing identifier is automatically assigned to each account by the system. It can be retrieved from any message disposition notification receipt, under attribute: “X-Cyclone-To:”
help.routing.id.03: For AS2 users, the routing identifier has to be created by the company. It is recommended that the company's data universal numbering system number be used for this, but any alpha-numeric text string is acceptable.
help.routing.id.04: For any further questions on the routing identifier, please contact the Food and Drug Administration Help Desk at
help.primary.contact: The Primary REP contact is the person to be contacted by Health Canada if there are any issues or clarifications required for this template when it is submitted for finalization.
help.is.3rd.party: Third party companies must obtain their Company Identifier and Contact Identifiers (by enrolling themselves using the REP Company template) prior to enrolling another company on their behalf.
help.contact.name: This company representative full contact information should be listed in the company representative table above.
help.licence.num: List all impacted licences, separated by a hard return (can copy and paste)
